class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">The vibe-coding era gave us leverage, but it also gave us entropy.</p><p id="c94f" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">Raw LLM capability is no longer the bottleneck. We’ve solved “can the model do X?” What we haven’t solved is “can the model keep doing X reliably, across sessions, without losing context, without undoing yesterday’s work, without drifting into chaos?”</p><p id="8636" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">The new bottlenecks are structural:</p><p id="2c0f" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl"><strong class="oi ja">Context rot.</strong> The model forgets what matters as the window fills with noise.</p><p id="01d2" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl"><strong class="oi ja">Drift across sessions.</strong> Every conversation starts cold. Last week’s decisions evaporate.</p><p id="5951" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl"><strong class="oi ja">Unverifiable “done.”</strong> The agent says it’s finished. Is it? How would you know?</p><p id="a910" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl"><strong class="oi ja">Agents undoing each other.</strong> Two parallel workers touching the same file. One wins, one loses, and nobody notices until production breaks.</p><p id="cbb9" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">These aren’t prompting problems. These are systems problems.</p><p id="47af" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">Four projects have emerged independently, each wrestling with the same fundamental question: <strong class="oi ja">How do you turn a probabilistic model into a reliable machine?</strong></p><ul class=""><li id="8498" class="og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa pw px py bl"><strong class="oi ja">Superpowers</strong> (<a class="ah pv" href="https://github.com/obra/superpowers" rel="noopener ugc nofollow" target="_blank">github.com/obra/superpowers</a>)</li><li id="be88" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa pw px py bl"><strong class="oi ja">Get Shit Done</strong> (<a class="ah pv" href="https://github.com/glittercowboy/get-shit-done" rel="noopener ugc nofollow" target="_blank">github.com/glittercowboy/get-shit-done</a>)</li><li id="5277" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa pw px py bl"><strong class="oi ja">Personal AI Infrastructure (PAI)</strong> (<a class="ah pv" href="https://github.com/danielmiessler/Personal_AI_Infrastructure" rel="noopener ugc nofollow" target="_blank">github.com/danielmiessler/Personal_AI_Infrastructure</a>)</li><li id="c1b2" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa pw px py bl"><strong class="oi ja">Moltbot</strong> (<a class="ah pv" href="https://github.com/moltbot/moltbot" rel="noopener ugc nofollow" target="_blank">github.com/moltbot/moltbot</a>)</li></ul><p id="81a0" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">Each answers a different axis of the problem. Together, they reveal something important about where AI tooling is headed.</p><h2 id="fd18" class="qe qf iz bg qg qh qi qj gx qk ql qm gz qn qo qp qq qr qs qt qu qv qw qx qy qz bl">The Shared Shape of All Agent Systems</h2><p id="b4fc" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ra ol om on rb op oq ha rc os ot hd rd ov ow hg re oy oz pa ia bl">What’s striking about these projects is their convergent evolution. They were built by different people, for different use cases, without coordination. Yet they all landed on the same architectural patterns.</p><p id="0429" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">Multi-agent orchestration. Persistent state across sessions. Artifact-first planning. Deterministic workflows. Git as the system of record. Verification before “done.”</p><p id="f334" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">This isn’t coincidence. It’s necessity.</p><p id="26ec" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">Every serious agent framework eventually reinvents the same five things:</p><ol class=""><li id="e3de" class="og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa rf px py bl"><strong class="oi ja">Planning artifacts.</strong> Documents that externalize intent before execution.</li><li id="eff2" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa rf px py bl"><strong class="oi ja">Execution isolation.</strong> Agents that can’t step on each other.</li><li id="57a5" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa rf px py bl"><strong class="oi ja">Verification gates.</strong> Proof that work is actually complete.</li><li id="99b7" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa rf px py bl"><strong class="oi ja">Memory.</strong> State that persists beyond a single conversation.</li><li id="c0a8" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa rf px py bl"><strong class="oi ja">Deterministic shells around probabilistic cores.</strong> Structure that constrains chaos.</li></ol><p id="c243" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">The probabilistic model generates. The deterministic system verifies, coordinates, and remembers. That’s the pattern.</p><h2 id="5adc" class="qe qf iz bg qg qh qi qj gx qk ql qm gz qn qo qp qq qr qs qt qu qv qw qx qy qz bl">Superpowers: Turning Vibes into Discipline</h2><p id="b1be" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ra ol om on rb op oq ha rc os ot hd rd ov ow hg re oy oz pa ia bl"><strong class="oi ja">Repo:</strong> <a class="ah pv" href="https://github.com/obra/superpowers" rel="noopener ugc nofollow" target="_blank">github.com/obra/superpowers</a></p><p id="2fc5" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">Superpowers exists because agents take shortcuts. They rationalize skipping tests. They drift from designs. They optimize for “works” instead of “correct.” Superpowers forces rigor in generative environments.</p><h3 id="fe23" class="rg qf iz bg qg gw rh ef gx gy ri eh gz ha rj hb hc hd rk he hf hg rl hh hi rm bl">How It Works</h3><p id="50a3" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ra ol om on rb op oq ha rc os ot hd rd ov ow hg re oy oz pa ia bl">The core unit is a <strong class="oi ja">Skill</strong>: a Markdown workflow with frontmatter that defines a deterministic checklist and flowchart. Skills convert “how I like to work” into executable process.</p><p id="bcaf" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">When a task arrives, the agent scans all available skills. If there’s even a 1% chance a skill matches, it invokes that skill. No shortcuts. No rationalization.</p><p id="ee45" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">The execution model is deliberate:</p><ol class=""><li id="05f2" class="og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa rf px py bl">Design first</li><li id="bc14" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa rf px py bl">Write a plan</li><li id="2eaf" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa rf px py bl">Execute via Subagent-Driven Development</li><li id="5f75" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa rf px py bl">Two-stage review per task</li></ol><p id="cecf" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">Superpowers enforces test-driven development as an iron law. Red, green, refactor, commit. Code written before tests is deleted. Not deprecated. Deleted.</p><h3 id="93ba" class="rg qf iz bg qg gw rh ef gx gy ri eh gz ha rj hb hc hd rk he hf hg rl hh hi rm bl">Why It Matters</h3><p id="aed3" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ra ol om on rb op oq ha rc os ot hd rd ov ow hg re oy oz pa ia bl">Superpowers treats the agent as an apprentice under a craft system. It doesn’t trust the model to maintain discipline on its own, because experience shows it won’t. Instead, it externalizes discipline into the system itself.</p><p id="8c47" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">This is ideal for Claude Code users, long coding sessions, and teams that want consistent AI behavior regardless of which human is supervising. The mental model: <strong class="oi ja">agent as apprentice.</strong></p></div></div></div><div class="ac ci rn ro rp rq" role="separator"><span class="rr by bn go rs rt"></span><span class="rr by bn go rs rt"></span><span class="rr by bn go rs"></span></div><div class="ia it iu iv iw"><div class="ac ci"><div class="cp bi ig ih ii ij"><h2 id="4fab" class="qe qf iz bg qg qh ru qj gx qk rv qm gz qn rw qp qq qr rx qt qu qv ry qx qy qz bl">Get Shit Done: Context Engineering at Scale</h2><p id="e404" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ra ol om on rb op oq ha rc os ot hd rd ov ow hg re oy oz pa ia bl"><strong class="oi ja">Repo:</strong> <a class="ah pv" href="https://github.com/glittercowboy/get-shit-done" rel="noopener ugc nofollow" target="_blank">github.com/glittercowboy/get-shit-done</a></p><p id="e61c" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">Get Shit Done starts from a simple observation: Claude’s quality degrades as context fills. By the time you’re 80% through a 200k token window, you’re not getting the same model you started with. Attention diffuses. Important details get lost in the noise.</p><p id="fc4d" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">The solution is architectural: never let that happen.</p><h3 id="5c04" class="rg qf iz bg qg gw rh ef gx gy ri eh gz ha rj hb hc hd rk he hf hg rl hh hi rm bl">How It Works</h3><p id="efee" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ra ol om on rb op oq ha rc os ot hd rd ov ow hg re oy oz pa ia bl">GSD maintains thin orchestrators that use only 15–20% of their context window. Their job is coordination, not execution. When actual work needs doing, they spawn fat executors: fresh agents with full 200k windows devoted entirely to a single task.</p><p id="e733" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">Files become prompts. The <code class="de rz sa sb sc b">@path/to/file.md</code> syntax loads artifacts at runtime. Plans reference roadmaps, specs, and research. The filesystem is the context management system.</p><p id="3938" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">Execution happens in waves. Tasks are grouped by dependency. Each wave executes in parallel. Within each wave, every task gets:</p><ul class=""><li id="725a" class="og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa pw px py bl">A fresh agent</li><li id="95f0" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa pw px py bl">An atomic commit</li><li id="30dd" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa pw px py bl">Verification</li></ul><p id="6285" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">That verification model is particularly rigorous: existence (does the artifact exist?), substantive (does it contain real content?), wired (is it connected to the rest of the system?), functional (does it actually work?).</p><h3 id="d7d1" class="rg qf iz bg qg gw rh ef gx gy ri eh gz ha rj hb hc hd rk he hf hg rl hh hi rm bl">Why It Matters</h3><p id="4144" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ra ol om on rb op oq ha rc os ot hd rd ov ow hg re oy oz pa ia bl">GSD scales a solo developer into a team. You’re no longer one person with an AI assistant. You’re a conductor with a swarm of specialized workers, each fresh, each isolated, each verified.</p><p id="c37e" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">This is ideal for large greenfield projects, brownfield refactors, and multi-day agent loops where quality typically collapses. The mental model: <strong class="oi ja">agent swarm under a conductor.</strong></p><h2 id="8139" class="qe qf iz bg qg qh qi qj gx qk ql qm gz qn qo qp qq qr qs qt qu qv qw qx qy qz bl">Personal AI Infrastructure: The Long-Lived Digital Self</h2><p id="6ecf" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ra ol om on rb op oq ha rc os ot hd rd ov ow hg re oy oz pa ia bl"><strong class="oi ja">Repo:</strong> <a class="ah pv" href="https://github.com/danielmiessler/Personal_AI_Infrastructure" rel="noopener ugc nofollow" target="_blank">github.com/danielmiessler/Personal_AI_Infrastructure</a></p><p id="7670" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">PAI takes a different angle entirely. Where Superpowers focuses on craft and GSD focuses on execution, PAI focuses on identity. How does your AI know who you are? How does it remember what you care about? How does it get better at serving you specifically?</p><h3 id="c600" class="rg qf iz bg qg gw rh ef gx gy ri eh gz ha rj hb hc hd rk he hf hg rl hh hi rm bl">How It Works</h3><p id="d8ef" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ra ol om on rb op oq ha rc os ot hd rd ov ow hg re oy oz pa ia bl">The foundation is <strong class="oi ja">TELOS</strong>: ten documents that define identity and goals. These aren’t prompts. They’re living documents that evolve as the system learns about you.</p><p id="76df" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">Every interaction follows a core algorithm:</p><pre class="pf pg ph pi pj sd sc se bq sf bc bl"><span id="a449" class="sg qf iz sc b bh sh si m sj sk">Observe → Think → Plan → Build → Execute → Verify → Learn</span></pre><p id="0b4a" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">That “Learn” step is crucial. Every task generates ideal state criteria (what success looks like) and anti-criteria (what failure looks like). The system doesn’t just complete tasks; it builds a model of what matters.</p><p id="a8b5" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">Hooks fire at key moments: session start, pre-tool-use, post-tool-use, stop. These hooks enable behavioral adaptation without rewriting core logic.</p><p id="a0ef" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">Memory operates in tiers:</p><ul class=""><li id="b3e2" class="og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa pw px py bl"><strong class="oi ja">HOT:</strong> Current state and active context</li><li id="a934" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa pw px py bl"><strong class="oi ja">WARM:</strong> Recent learning and patterns</li><li id="6d6b" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa pw px py bl"><strong class="oi ja">COLD:</strong> Historical record and long-term knowledge</li></ul><p id="695e" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">The system captures signals continuously: ratings, sentiment, outcomes, effort. Over time, it knows which approaches work for you and which don’t.</p><h3 id="77ef" class="rg qf iz bg qg gw rh ef gx gy ri eh gz ha rj hb hc hd rk he hf hg rl hh hi rm bl">Why It Matters</h3><p id="4c2a" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ra ol om on rb op oq ha rc os ot hd rd ov ow hg re oy oz pa ia bl">PAI treats AI as identity-aware infrastructure. It’s not trying to be the best generic assistant. It’s trying to be the best assistant <em class="pb">for you</em>, and to get better at that over time.</p><p id="4cca" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">This is ideal for knowledge workers, creative professionals, and anyone building a personal operating system. The mental model: <strong class="oi ja">agent as evolving partner.</strong></p></div></div></div><div class="ac ci rn ro rp rq" role="separator"><span class="rr by bn go rs rt"></span><span class="rr by bn go rs rt"></span><span class="rr by bn go rs"></span></div><div class="ia it iu iv iw"><div class="ac ci"><div class="cp bi ig ih ii ij"><h2 id="3616" class="qe qf iz bg qg qh ru qj gx qk rv qm gz qn rw qp qq qr rx qt qu qv ry qx qy qz bl">Moltbot: The Control Plane for Your Life</h2><p id="efe2" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ra ol om on rb op oq ha rc os ot hd rd ov ow hg re oy oz pa ia bl"><strong class="oi ja">Repo:</strong> <a class="ah pv" href="https://github.com/moltbot/moltbot" rel="noopener ugc nofollow" target="_blank">github.com/moltbot/moltbot</a></p><p id="3b56" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">Moltbot asks a question the other frameworks don’t: where does your AI actually live?</p><p id="c0ea" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">Right now, AI lives in chat windows. You go to Claude.ai, or you open ChatGPT, or you fire up a terminal. The AI exists in that context, for that session. But that’s not how useful infrastructure works. Useful infrastructure is ambient. It’s everywhere you need it, without you having to seek it out.</p><h3 id="6c06" class="rg qf iz bg qg gw rh ef gx gy ri eh gz ha rj hb hc hd rk he hf hg rl hh hi rm bl">How It Works</h3><p id="bcbe" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ra ol om on rb op oq ha rc os ot hd rd ov ow hg re oy oz pa ia bl">Moltbot runs a local gateway on localhost:18789 that unifies every channel you might want to talk through: WhatsApp, Telegram, Slack, Discord, iMessage, web. The message flow is simple:</p><pre class="pf pg ph pi pj sd sc se bq sf bc bl"><span id="c128" class="sg qf iz sc b bh sh si m sj sk">Channel → Router → Agent → Tools → Response → Channel</span></pre><p id="3605" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">Each channel can route to isolated agents with their own contexts and capabilities. The agents are RPC clients of the gateway, meaning they’re modular and replaceable.</p><p id="7b11" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">Tools include browser automation, canvas rendering, bash execution, cron scheduling, and a plugin system. This isn’t just a chat interface. It’s a runtime.</p><h3 id="2fe8" class="rg qf iz bg qg gw rh ef gx gy ri eh gz ha rj hb hc hd rk he hf hg rl hh hi rm bl">Why It Matters</h3><p id="aa7b" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ra ol om on rb op oq ha rc os ot hd rd ov ow hg re oy oz pa ia bl">Moltbot turns AI into ambient infrastructure. The question “where should I talk to my AI?” becomes meaningless because the answer is “wherever you already are.”</p><p id="3cd1" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">This enables scheduled work, background agents, and multi-device presence. You’re not just using AI when you remember to open the app. AI is part of your operating environment, running tasks while you sleep, responding across platforms, maintaining presence.</p><p id="57b1" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">This is ideal for personal automation, life OS builders, and cross-platform workflows. The mental model: <strong class="oi ja">AI as operating substrate.</strong></p><h2 id="d678" class="qe qf iz bg qg qh qi qj gx qk ql qm gz qn qo qp qq qr qs qt qu qv qw qx qy qz bl">Four Archetypes</h2><p id="6591" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ra ol om on rb op oq ha rc os ot hd rd ov ow hg re oy oz pa ia bl">Framework | Archetype | Core Question <br>Superpowers | Craft System | How do I enforce rigor? <br>Get Shit Done | Orchestration Engine | How do I scale myself? <br>PAI | Personal Operating System | How does my AI know me?<br>Moltbot AI | Control Plane | Where does my AI live?</p><h2 id="cb92" class="qe qf iz bg qg qh qi qj gx qk ql qm gz qn qo qp qq qr qs qt qu qv qw qx qy qz bl">When Should You Use Which?</h2><p id="7776" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ra ol om on rb op oq ha rc os ot hd rd ov ow hg re oy oz pa ia bl">These frameworks aren’t interchangeable. Each emerges to solve a specific failure mode at a certain scale of AI usage. Use this as a decision lens:</p><p id="b5bf" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl"><strong class="oi ja">Reach for Superpowers when:</strong></p><ul class=""><li id="f01b" class="og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa pw px py bl">You’re mostly coding inside Claude Code</li><li id="bb41" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa pw px py bl">The agent “forgets” discipline</li><li id="60c4" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa pw px py bl">Tests get skipped, designs drift, shortcuts appear</li><li id="6df1" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa pw px py bl">You want AI to behave like a trained engineer</li></ul><p id="6e4d" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl"><strong class="oi ja">Reach for Get Shit Done when:</strong></p><ul class=""><li id="3442" class="og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa pw px py bl">Projects span days or weeks</li><li id="8993" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa pw px py bl">Claude’s quality degrades mid-build</li><li id="3a54" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa pw px py bl">Agents overwrite each other</li><li id="ef95" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa pw px py bl">You need parallelism and isolation</li></ul><p id="26a6" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl"><strong class="oi ja">Reach for PAI when:</strong></p><ul class=""><li id="ff66" class="og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa pw px py bl">You want your AI to know you</li><li id="0016" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa pw px py bl">Every session feels like starting over</li><li id="663c" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa pw px py bl">You want compounding advantage over time</li><li id="294f" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa pw px py bl">You care about identity, goals, and growth</li></ul><p id="5fb4" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl"><strong class="oi ja">Reach for Moltbot when:</strong></p><ul class=""><li id="d773" class="og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa pw px py bl">You want AI everywhere</li><li id="29e1" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa pw px py bl">You bounce between Slack, SMS, Discord, terminal</li><li id="93bb" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa pw px py bl">You want background agents and scheduled work</li><li id="3403" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa pw px py bl">You’re building a “life OS”</li></ul><p id="0deb" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">This isn’t about “best.” It’s about which failure you’re currently hitting.</p><h2 id="82fc" class="qe qf iz bg qg qh qi qj gx qk ql qm gz qn qo qp qq qr qs qt qu qv qw qx qy qz bl">A Layered Agent Stack</h2><p id="3c6c" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ra ol om on rb op oq ha rc os ot hd rd ov ow hg re oy oz pa ia bl">These systems don’t have to compete. They form a natural stack:</p><pre class="pf pg ph pi pj sd sc se bq sf bc bl"><span id="53d8" class="sg qf iz sc b bh sh si m sj sk">Moltbot       → Control plane / substrate<br>PAI           → Personal operating system<br>Get Shit Done → Project execution engine<br>Superpowers   → Craft and workflow discipline</span></pre><p id="9b93" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">Seen this way:</p><ul class=""><li id="37b5" class="og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa pw px py bl">Moltbot answers: “Where does my AI live?”</li><li id="922c" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa pw px py bl">PAI answers: “Who am I, and what am I building toward?”</li><li id="320b" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa pw px py bl">GSD answers: “How do I execute large projects reliably?”</li><li id="2580" class="og oh iz oi b oj pz ol om on qa op oq ha qb os ot hd qc ov ow hg qd oy oz pa pw px py bl">Superpowers answers: “How do I enforce rigor in every step?”</li></ul><p id="dd0a" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">This implies something important: the future isn’t “one agent tool to rule them all.” Systems that learn.</p><p id="2cd4" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">All four frameworks converge on the same deeper pattern: artifact-first design, deterministic shells, externalized cognition, memory as infrastructure, verification as truth.</p><p id="e411" class="pw-post-body-paragraph og oh iz oi b oj ok ol om on oo op oq ha or os ot hd ou ov ow hg ox oy oz pa ia bl">They’re not chatbots.
